content:
WSTrustMessage Class

In this Article

The Base class for RST and RSTR.

Syntax

Declaration

public abstract class WSTrustMessage : System.IdentityModel.OpenObject

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • System.IdentityModel.OpenObject
  • WSTrustMessage

Inherited Members

Properties
,
Equals(Object)
,
Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetHashCode()
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
,
ToString()

Remarks

For more information about the message and elements that this class represents, see the version of the WS-Trust specification that applies to your scenario.

Constructors summary

WSTrustMessage()

Initializes a new instance of the WSTrustMessage class.

Properties summary

AllowPostdating

Gets or sets the contents of the wst:AllowPostdating element.
AppliesTo

Gets or sets the contents of the wsp:AppliesTo element.
AuthenticationType

Gets or sets the contents of the wst:AuthenticationType element.
BinaryExchange

Gets or sets the contents of the wst:BinaryExchange element.
CanonicalizationAlgorithm

Gets or sets the contents of the wst:CanonicalizationAlgorithm element.
Context

Gets or sets the contents of the Context attribute on the RST or RSTR.
EncryptionAlgorithm

Gets or sets the contents of the wst:EncryptionAlgorithm element.
EncryptWith

Gets or sets the contents of the wst:EncryptWith element.
Entropy

Gets or sets the contents of the wst:Entropy element.
KeySizeInBits

Gets or sets the contents of the wst:KeySize element inside a RequestSecurityToken (RST) message.
KeyType

Gets or sets the contents of the wst:KeyType element inside a RequestSecurityToken (RST) message.
KeyWrapAlgorithm

Gets or sets the contents of the wst:KeyWrapAlgorithm element.
Lifetime

Gets or sets the contents of the wst:Lifetime element inside a RequestSecurityToken (RST) message.
ReplyTo

Gets or sets the address to be used for replying to the Relying Party.
RequestType

Gets or sets the wst:RequestType element.
SignatureAlgorithm

Gets or sets the contents of the wst:SignatureAlgorithm element.
SignWith

Gets or sets the contents of the wst:SignWith element.
TokenType

Gets or sets the contents of the wst:TokenType element.
UseKey

Gets or sets the contents of the wst:UseKey element.

Constructors

  • WSTrustMessage()

    Initializes a new instance of the WSTrustMessage class.

    protected WSTrustMessage ();

    Remarks

    The default constructor for extensibility.

Properties

  • AllowPostdating

    Gets or sets the contents of the wst:AllowPostdating element.

    public bool AllowPostdating { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if returned tokens should allow requests for postdated tokens; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    This optional element indicates that returned tokens should allow requests for postdated tokens.

    This property is usually used with the token renewal binding.

  • AppliesTo

    Gets or sets the contents of the wsp:AppliesTo element.

    public System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.EndpointReference AppliesTo { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • EndpointReference

      An EndpointAddress that represents the endpoint address for which the security token is desired.

    Remarks

    This optional element specifies the endpoint address for which this security token is desired; for example, the service to which the token applies.

    Either wst:TokenType or wst:AppliesTo should be defined in the token request message. If both are specified, the wst:AppliesTo field takes precedence.

  • AuthenticationType

    Gets or sets the contents of the wst:AuthenticationType element.

    public string AuthenticationType { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A string that contains a URI that indicates the type of authentication desired.

    Remarks

    This optional element indicates the type of authentication desired, specified as a URI.

  • BinaryExchange

    Gets or sets the contents of the wst:BinaryExchange element.

    public System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.BinaryExchange BinaryExchange { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • BinaryExchange

      A BinaryExchange that contains the binary data exchanged. This includes the contents of the ValueType and EncodingType attributes as well as the actual data.

  • CanonicalizationAlgorithm

    Gets or sets the contents of the wst:CanonicalizationAlgorithm element.

    public string CanonicalizationAlgorithm { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A string that contains a URI that indicates the canonicalization algorithm.

  • Context

    Gets or sets the contents of the Context attribute on the RST or RSTR.

    public string Context { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A string that contains a URI that identifies the context of a request or response message.

    Remarks

    The optional Context attribute on an RST element specifies an identifier (context) for a request. All subsequent RSTR elements relating to this request must carry this attribute.

  • EncryptionAlgorithm

    Gets or sets the contents of the wst:EncryptionAlgorithm element.

    public string EncryptionAlgorithm { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A string that contains a URI that indicates the encryption algorithm.

    Remarks

    This optional URI element indicates the desired encryption algorithm used within the returned token.

  • EncryptWith

    Gets or sets the contents of the wst:EncryptWith element.

    public string EncryptWith { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A string that contains a URI that indicates the desired encryption algoritm to be used with the issued security token.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      An attempt to set the property to null or an empty string occurs.

    Remarks

    This optional URI element indicates the desired encryption algorithm to be used with the issued security token.

  • Entropy

    Gets or sets the contents of the wst:Entropy element.

    public System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.Entropy Entropy { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Entropy

      A Entropy that represents the contents of the entropy element.

    Remarks

    This optional element allows a requestor to specify entropy that is to be used in creating the key. This is commonly used in a token issuance request message. The value of this element should be either an EncryptedKey or BinarySecret depending on whether or not the key is encrypted.

  • KeySizeInBits

    Gets or sets the contents of the wst:KeySize element inside a RequestSecurityToken (RST) message.

    public Nullable<int> KeySizeInBits { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Nullable<Int32>

      The key size in bits.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      An attempt to set a value less than or equal to zero occurs.

  • KeyType

    Gets or sets the contents of the wst:KeyType element inside a RequestSecurityToken (RST) message.

    public string KeyType { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A string that contains the URI that identifies the type of key desired.

    Remarks

    This optional URI element indicates the type of key desired in the security token.

  • KeyWrapAlgorithm

    Gets or sets the contents of the wst:KeyWrapAlgorithm element.

    public string KeyWrapAlgorithm { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A string that contains the URI that identifies the key wrap algorithm.

    Remarks

    This optional URI indicates the desired algorithm to use for key wrapping when STS encrypts the issued token for the relying party using an asymmetric key.

  • Lifetime

    Gets or sets the contents of the wst:Lifetime element inside a RequestSecurityToken (RST) message.

    public System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.Lifetime Lifetime { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Lifetime

      A Lifetime that represents the desired time during which the returned token will be valid.

    Remarks

    This optional element specifies the desired time range during which the returned security token is valid.

  • ReplyTo

    Gets or sets the address to be used for replying to the Relying Party.

    public string ReplyTo { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A string that contains the address.

    Remarks

    This is a local extension that is used exclusively in passive scenarios with the WS-Federation protocol.

  • RequestType

    Gets or sets the wst:RequestType element.

    public string RequestType { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A string that contains a URI that indicates the request type; for example, one of the constants defined in the RequestTypes class.

    Remarks

    This required element indicates the request type.

  • SignatureAlgorithm

    Gets or sets the contents of the wst:SignatureAlgorithm element.

    public string SignatureAlgorithm { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A string that contains a URI that indicates the signature algorithm.

    Remarks

    This optional URI element indicates the desired signature algorithm used within the returned token.

  • SignWith

    Gets or sets the contents of the wst:SignWith element.

    public string SignWith { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A string that contains a URI that identifies the desired signature algorithm.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      An attempt to set the value to null or an empty string occurs.

    Remarks

    This optional URI element indicates the desired signature algorithm to be used with the issued security token. This is an extension to the RequestSecurityToken element.

  • TokenType

    Gets or sets the contents of the wst:TokenType element.

    public string TokenType { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A string that contains a URI that indicates the token type.

    Remarks

    This optional element indicates the desired token type.

  • UseKey

    Gets or sets the contents of the wst:UseKey element.

    public System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.UseKey UseKey { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • UseKey

      A UseKey that contains the key.

    Remarks

    If the requestor wishes to use an existing key rather than create a new one, then this property can be used to reference a security token containing the desired key. This is commonly used in the asymetric key issurance case.
